title.narrative: Integrated Rural Development Sector Project in the Central Provinces

description.narrative: The overall impact of the project is expected to enhance rural livelihood opportunities and standard of living for the rural population residing in the Central Region of Viet Nam. This is to be achieved through improved quality, greater coverage and bettter integration of rural infrastructure. The Project has the following components: (i) rural and coastal infrastructure, further divided into (a) rural and coastal infrastructure subprojects, and (b) design support studies and community participation; (ii) capacity building; and (iii) central project management.

participating-org.narrative: Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development

title.narrative: Reports and Recommendations of the President

description.narrative: Improved quality, greater coverage, and better integration of rural infrastructure in the Central Region with an increased awareness for the need for O&M.

title.narrative: Reports and Recommendations of the President
At least 300,000 more beneficiaries will have access to improved PRI from 2013 by 2018

description.narrative: Improved quality, greater coverage, and better integration of rural infrastructure in the Central Region with an increased awareness for the need for O&M.

title.narrative: Travel time on improved roads reduced by 50% by 2018.

description.narrative: Improved quality, greater coverage, and better integration of rural infrastructure in the Central Region with an increased awareness for the need for O&M.

title.narrative: Time spent collecting water reduced by an average of 2 hours per day (from 4 hours ) by 2014.

description.narrative: Improved quality, greater coverage, and better integration of rural infrastructure in the Central Region with an increased awareness for the need for O&M.

title.narrative: Proportion of off-farm income in total household income increased by 20% (from 53% to 73%) by 2014.

description.narrative: Improved quality, greater coverage, and better integration of rural infrastructure in the Central Region with an increased awareness for the need for O&M.
